work.summary:
We're adding atomised information for each transaction to your
                  existing banking app — not just how much you spent and where,
                  but also what you bought. I joined at an early stage,
                  helping from start to define the consumer facing product and the merchant
                  dashboard, a kind of Google Analytics for offline retailers.

Worked on Radar, a webapp for market research. I was in charge
                  of the design process — from research (of what to build) to
                  the final look & feel of the app. I designed in Sketch, following
                  Atomic Design principles, and I helped creating and mantaining a
                  component-based style guide. I've also designed and coded the company
                  website (WordPress) & the app website (Jekyll).

Internship with il “Gruppo Digitale l’Espresso” — one of the main
                  publishers in Italy. I worked as a front-end developer on a digital
                  storytelling project. The visual essay used interactive data visualisations
                  (built in D3.js) to guide readers through the story and make data more accessible.
Written software reviews — focused on usability —, tutorials and opinion articles for two tech magazines published by this editor

courses: GIS: Introduction to the Spatial Humanities
Metadata and Systems for digital assets and media
